result.execSummary:
The defendant Olivia A. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

to Surety - per 5/9/16 court order.
Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] case called at 2:45pm. 
Defendant Olivia A. Johnson in court with Attorney David Westrick.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Domestic Abuse finding made.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #- 1.

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Johnson on Probation for one year, with conditions:
--to undergo assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--not to commit any acts of violence or make any threats
--not to posses any dangerous weapons
--to pay costs and surcharges including the domestic abuse surcharge
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 

Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The $650 Cash Bond is to be applied to payment of costs. 
recess 2:55pm

Status conference on May 9, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case ca.led at 11:13 am [Clerk SH]
Attorney David Westrick in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Westrick requests matter be set over in a few weeks, have not spoke with DA Happ about offer. Client mistakenly thought the hearing was on the 21st.
DA Happ informs the Court that the Defendant failed to appear at the prior STC, presents concerns about non-appearances.
Court reviews prior minutes that indicate Atty Westrick informing client not to appear; grants Atty Westrick's request and requires Defendant's appearance at next hearing or the filing and approval of the court of authorization
Recess: 11:16 am

Case called at 1:33 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV] 
Attorney David Westrick in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Westrick informs the Court that he had left on vacation, secretary was cooresponding with DA Happ. Believe there was an error in scheduling as notice went to client through secretary as March 8th as secretary relied on DA Happ, while was out on vacatio; so told her not to come today. Request matter be adjourned to March 8th or if it is not scheduled on that date, that it be added.
Clerk checks Court's calendar and indicates that case is not scheduled on March 8th and that it can not be added.
Court informs parties that It will reschedule matter for status
Recess: 1:37 pm
